  • CVEï¼š CVE-2020-12641

æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š å‘½ä»¤æ‰§è¡Œ

æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸¥é‡

æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š Roundcube Webmail 1.4.4ä¹‹å‰çš„ç‰ˆæœ¬ä¸­å­˜åœ¨å‘½ä»¤æ³¨å…¥æ¼æ´ï¼Œç”±äºim_convert_pathæˆ–im_identify_pathé…ç½®è®¾ç½®ä¸­çš„shellå…ƒå­—ç¬¦å¯¼è‡´ï¼Œæ”»å‡»è€…å¯ä»¥æ‰§è¡Œä»»æ„ä»£ç ï¼Œåˆ©ç”¨æ­¤æ¼æ´éœ€è¦æ”»å‡»è€…æ§åˆ¶é…ç½®è®¾ç½®ã€‚

äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Roundcube

äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Roundcube Webmail

å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š version < 1.4.4

æœç´¢è¯­æ³•ï¼š http.component:â€roundcubeâ€

æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates/issues/12153

ç±»å‹ï¼š projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates:github issues

æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°

Description:

Roundcube Webmail before 1.4.4 contains a command injection caused by shell metacharacters in configuration settings for im_convert_path or im_identify_path, letting attackers execute arbitrary code, exploit requires attacker to control configuration settings.

Severity: Critical
POC:
  • https://github.com/DrunkenShells/Disclosures/tree/master/CVE-2020-12641-Command%20Injection-Roundcube
  • https://github.com/mbadanoiu/MAL-004
  • https://github.com/mbadanoiu/CVE-2020-12641

KEV: True

Shodan Query: http.component:"roundcube"

Acceptance Criteria: The template must include a complete POC and should not rely solely on version-based detection. Contributors are required to provide debug data(-debug) along with the template to help the triage team with validation or can also share a vulnerable environment like docker file.

Rewards will only be given once the template is fully validated by the team. Templates that are incomplete or invalid will not be accepted. Avoid adding code templates for CVEs that can be achieved using HTTP, TCP, or JavaScript. Such templates are blocked by default and wonâ€™t produce results, so we prioritize creating templates with other protocols unless exceptions are made.

You can check the FAQ for the Nuclei Templates Community Rewards Program here.

entry.title: WordPress Traffic Monitor Plugin æœªæˆæƒæ¼æ´
entry.content:
æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯

æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š WordPress Traffic Monitor Plugin æœªæˆæƒæ¼æ´

æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š

  • CVEï¼š CVE-2025-5815

æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š æœªæˆæƒè®¿é—®

æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸­å±

æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š CVE-2025-5815æ˜¯WordPress Traffic Monitoræ’ä»¶ä¸­çš„ä¸€ä¸ªæœªæˆæƒæ¼æ´ï¼Œå…è®¸è¿œç¨‹æ”»å‡»è€…é€šè¿‡æš´éœ²çš„AJAXåŠ¨ä½œæ— éœ€è®¤è¯å³å¯ç¦ç”¨æœºå™¨äººæ—¥å¿—è®°å½•ã€‚æ­¤æ¼æ´æºäºå¯¹tfcm_set_bot_flags AJAXåŠ¨ä½œç¼ºå°‘è®¤è¯å’Œæˆæƒæ£€æŸ¥ï¼Œå¯¼è‡´æ”»å‡»è€…å¯ç¯¡æ”¹æ’ä»¶è®¾ç½®ï¼Œç¦ç”¨æœºå™¨äººæ—¥å¿—è®°å½•ï¼Œä»è€Œé€ƒé¿å—å½±å“WordPressç½‘ç«™ä¸Šçš„æ´»åŠ¨ç›‘æ§ã€‚

äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š WordPress

äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Traffic Monitor Plugin

å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š <= 3.2.2

æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/RootHarpy/CVE-2025-5815-Nuclei-Template

ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2025:github search

ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶

  • CVE-2025-5815.yaml
  • README.md

æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°

ğŸ“„ Nuclei Template for CVE-2025-5815

ğŸš€ Overview

This repository features a Nuclei template specifically designed to detect an Unauthenticated Bot Logging Disable Vulnerability (CVE-2025-5815) in the Traffic Monitor WordPress plugin. This issue allows unauthenticated attackers to remotely disable bot logging via a vulnerable AJAX action.

ğŸ” Vulnerability Description

CVE-2025-5815 arises from missing authentication and authorization checks on the tfcm_set_bot_flags AJAX action in the Traffic Monitor plugin for WordPress. This allows remote attackers to tamper with plugin settings, disabling bot logging without requiring login credentials â€” leading to evasion of activity monitoring on affected WordPress sites.

ğŸ›‘ Affected Versions

  • Traffic Monitor Plugin: Versions up to and including 3.2.2

ğŸ“Š CVSS Score

  • Base Score: 5.3 (Medium)

ğŸ·ï¸ CVSS Vector

  • CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N

ğŸ“‹ Template Details

This Nuclei template attempts to exploit the vulnerable AJAX endpoint by sending an unauthenticated request to admin-ajax.php with the action=tfcm_set_bot_flags parameter and checks for a success confirmation in the response body.

ğŸ› ï¸ Usage Instructions

To use this template with Nuclei, make sure Nuclei is installed on your system. Then run the following command:

Replace path/to/CVE-2025-5815.yaml with the actual path to your template file and <target_url> with the target website URL.

ğŸ‘¤ Author

This template was developed by RootHarpy. For inquiries, collaboration, or contributions, feel free to connect via GitHub.

entry.title: The REST API Custom API Generator For Cross Platform And Import Export In WP plugin for
entry.content:
é“¾æ¥ï¼š https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-hqr5-32x6-7hw9

CVSS è¯„åˆ†ï¼š 9.8

å‚è€ƒé“¾æ¥ï¼š

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-5288

  • https://plugins.trac.wordpress.org/browser/import-export-with-custom-rest-api/tags/2.0.3/backend/methods/wot-rapi-import-functions.php#L123

  • https://wordpress.org/plugins/import-export-with-custom-rest-api/#developers

  • https://www.wordfence.com/threat-intel/vulnerabilities/id/0e2774fc-f028-436c-a8af-3c17378b9743?source=cve

  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-hqr5-32x6-7hw9

æè¿°ï¼š

The REST API | Custom API Generator For Cross Platform And Import Export In WP plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Privilege Escalation due to a missing capability check on the process_handler() function in versions 1.0.0 to 2.0.3. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to POST an arbitrary import_api URL, import specially crafted JSON, and thereby create a new user with full Administrator privileges.

entry.content:
æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯

æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š Cisco IOS Smart Install Buffer Overflow Vulnerability

æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š

  • CVEï¼š CVE-2018-0171

æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š ç¼“å†²åŒºæº¢å‡º

æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸¥é‡

æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š Cisco IOSå’ŒIOS XEè½¯ä»¶ä¸­çš„Smart InstallåŠŸèƒ½å­˜åœ¨ç¼“å†²åŒºæº¢å‡ºæ¼æ´ï¼Œç”±äºå¯¹Smart Installæ•°æ®åŒ…çš„ä¸å½“éªŒè¯ï¼Œæœªç»èº«ä»½éªŒè¯çš„è¿œç¨‹æ”»å‡»è€…å¯é€šè¿‡å‘é€ç‰¹åˆ¶çš„Smart Installæ¶ˆæ¯ï¼ˆTCPç«¯å£4786ï¼‰è§¦å‘è®¾å¤‡é‡æ–°åŠ è½½ã€æ‰§è¡Œä»»æ„ä»£ç æˆ–å¯¼è‡´æ— é™å¾ªç¯ã€‚

äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Cisco

äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software

æœç´¢è¯­æ³•ï¼š cpe:â€cpe:2.3:o:cisco:iosâ€

æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates/issues/12325

ç±»å‹ï¼š projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates:github issues

æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°

Description:

Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software contain a buffer overflow caused by improper validation of Smart Install packet data, letting unauthenticated remote attackers trigger device reload, execute arbitrary code, or cause indefinite loops, exploit requires sending crafted Smart Install message on TCP port 4786.

Severity: Critical
POC:
  • https://vulncheck.com/xdb/6d4b443f23fc
  • https://github.com/AlrikRr/Cisco-Smart-Exploit
  • https///github.com:AlrikRr/Cisco-Smart-Exploit.git

KEV: True

Shodan Query: cpe:"cpe:2.3:o:cisco:ios"

Acceptance Criteria: The template must include a complete POC and should not rely solely on version-based detection. Contributors are required to provide debug data(-debug) along with the template to help the triage team with validation or can also share a vulnerable environment like docker file.

Rewards will only be given once the template is fully validated by the team. Templates that are incomplete or invalid will not be accepted. Avoid adding code templates for CVEs that can be achieved using HTTP, TCP, or JavaScript. Such templates are blocked by default and wonâ€™t produce results, so we prioritize creating templates with other protocols unless exceptions are made.

You can check the FAQ for the Nuclei Templates Community Rewards Program here.

entry.content:
æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯

æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š Nagios Log Server å­˜å‚¨å‹è·¨ç«™è„šæœ¬æ¼æ´ï¼ˆæƒé™æå‡è‡³ç®¡ç†å‘˜ï¼‰

æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š

  • CVEï¼š CVE-2025-29471

æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š è·¨ç«™å¯æ‰§è¡Œè„šæœ¬

æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸¥é‡

æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š Nagios Log Server 2024R1.3.1ä¸­å­˜åœ¨ä¸€ä¸ªå­˜å‚¨å‹è·¨ç«™è„šæœ¬ï¼ˆXSSï¼‰æ¼æ´ï¼Œå…è®¸ä½æƒé™ç”¨æˆ·åœ¨å…¶ä¸ªäººèµ„æ–™çš„â€™emailâ€™å­—æ®µä¸­æ³¨å…¥æ¶æ„JavaScriptä»£ç ã€‚å½“ç®¡ç†å‘˜æŸ¥çœ‹å®¡è®¡æ—¥å¿—æ—¶ï¼Œè¯¥è„šæœ¬ä¼šæ‰§è¡Œï¼Œå¯¼è‡´é€šè¿‡æœªç»æˆæƒçš„ç®¡ç†å‘˜è´¦æˆ·åˆ›å»ºå®ç°æƒé™æå‡ã€‚åœ¨æŸäº›é…ç½®ä¸‹ï¼Œè¯¥æ¼æ´å¯è¢«ä¸²è”åˆ©ç”¨ä»¥å®ç°è¿œç¨‹ä»£ç æ‰§è¡Œï¼ˆRCEï¼‰ã€‚

äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Nagios

äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Nagios Log Server

å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š 2024R1.3.1åŠä»¥ä¸‹ç‰ˆæœ¬

æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/skraft9/CVE-2025-29471

ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2025:github search

ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶

  • README.md

æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°

Stored XSS Vulnerability in Nagios Log Server (Privilege Escalation to Admin)

Date: 2025-04-02

Exploit Author: Seth Kraft

Vendor Homepage: https://www.nagios.com/

Vendor Changelog: https://www.nagios.com/changelog/#log-server

Software Link: https://www.nagios.com/products/log-server/download/

Version: 2024R1.3.1 and below

Tested On: Nagios Log Server 2024R1.3.1 (default configuration, Ubuntu 20.04)

CWE: CWE-79, CWE-352, CWE-285, CWE-269, CWE-602

CVSS: 9.3 (CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:L/UI:R/S:C/VC:H/VI:H/VA:H)

Type: Stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS), Privilege Escalation

Exploit Risk: Critical

Disclosure

For research and authorized testing only. Do not use against systems without permission.

Description:

A stored XSS vulnerability in Nagios Log Server 2024R1.3.1 allows a low-privileged user to inject
malicious JavaScript into the â€˜emailâ€™ field of their profile. When an administrator views the audit logs,
the script executes, resulting in privilege escalation via unauthorized admin account creation.
The vulnerability can be chained to achieve remote code execution (RCE) in certain configurations.

PoC

  1. Log in as a standard (non-admin) user.

  2. Navigate to the profile update endpoint:

    http://<target-ip>/nagioslogserver/profile/update

  3. Inject the following payload into the email field:

  1. Host the xss.js payload on your external server with the following content:
  1. Wait for an administrator to view the audit logs. The JavaScript will execute, creating a new admin account:

Username: backdoor
Password: Password123!
